name: Adalbert Waffling
description: Famous magical theoretician. This famous thinker wrote all about magic. Every modern witch and wizard has learned from his writings.

name: Alberic Grunnion
description: Inventor of the Dungbomb.

name: Alberta Toothill
description: Winner of the All-England Wizarding Duelling Competition of 1430. Famously overcame the favorite, Samson Wiblin, with a Blasting Curse.

name: Albus Dumbledore
description: Headmaster of Hogwarts, renowned as the greatest sorcerer of the present age.

name: Alguff the Awful
description: Foul-smelling goblin nuisance. Well known throughout the goblin world for trying to sell vials of his sweat to a Dungbomb manufacturer.

name: Almerick Sawbridge
description: Famous for conquering the river troll that was terrorizing crossers of the Wye River.

name: Amarillo Lestoat
description: Flamboyant American vampire. Author of A Vampire's Monologue - intended to bore the reader into a stupor making him/her easier prey for vampires.

name: Andros the Invincible
description: Ancient Greek, dates unknown

name: Archibald Alderton
description: Famous for blowing up the hamlet of Little Dropping in Hampshire while attempting to magically mix a birthday cake.

name: Artemisia Lufkin
description: First witch to become Minister for Magic.

name: Babayaga
description: Russian hag who dwelled in a hut that stood on giant chicken legs. Ate children for breakfast - and presumably for lunch and tea.

name: Balfour Bane
description: Established the Committee on Experimental Charms.

name: Barberus Bragge
description: Introduced the Golden Snidget into Quidditch in 1269, changing the face of the game forever.

name: Beatrix Bloxam
description: Author of Toadstool Tales, a series of children's books since banned because they have been found to cause nausea and vomiting.

name: Beaumont Marjoribanks
title: Herbology Specialist
description: Pioneer of Herbology and collector of many rare and magical flowers, including underwater varieties. Discovered Gillyweed.

name: Bertie Bott
title: Inventor
description: Bertie Bott's Every Flavor Beans were created by him quite by mistake. His original purpose was to create tasty candies from food. He accidentally included a pair of dirty socks in his experiment!

name: Blenheim Stalk
description: Muggle expert and author of many books, including Muggles Who Notice, a study of Muggle awareness of magic.

name: Blodwyn Bludd
description: Known as the "vampire from the Valleys". Famous for singing to his victims in a sonorous bass baritone, before biting their necks.

name: Bowman Wright
title: Metal Charmer
description: Mother was a witch, and father was a Muggle. He is famous for combining his loves of magic, science, and sports by creating the Golden Snitch, which greatly improved the game of Quidditch.

name: Bran the Bloodthirsty
description: Lived in a castle on top of an enchanted Beanstalk. Apparently fond of eating bread made with ground bones and washed down with the blood of an Englishman. Was slain by a boy named Jack.

name: Bridget Wenlock
description: Famous Arithmancer. First to establish the magical properties of the number seven.

name: Burdock Muldoon
description: Chief of Wizards' Council (1448 - 1450).

name: Carlotta Pinkstone
description: Famous campaigner for lifting the International Confederation of Wizards' Statute of Secrecy and telling Muggles that wizards exist.

name: Cassandra Vablatsky
description: Celebrated Seer and author of Unfogging the Future.

name: Celestina Warbeck
description: Popular singing sorceress.

name: Chauncey Oldridge
description: First known victim of Dragon Pox.

name: Circe
title: Ancient Greek
description: Lived on the island of Aeaea. Expert at turning lost sailors into pigs.

name: Cliodne
title: Bird Animagus
description: The beautiful Irish druidess Cliodne had three magical birds that sang the sick to sleep and cured them. Legends say that she could take the shape of a sea bird or change into a wave. Her favorite hobby was flying. She discovered the properties of moondew.

name: Cordelia Misericordia
description: Hag representative at 14th century summit of the Wizards' Council.

name: Cornelius Agrippa
title: Author
description: Celebrated wizard imprisoned by Muggles for his writing, because they thought his books were evil.

name: Count Vlad Drakul
description: Notorious vampire who inspired the fictional Count Dracula created by Bram Stoker. Father of Vlad the Impaler.

name: Crispin Cronk
description: Sent to Azkaban for continuing to keep sphinxes in his back garden despite repeated warnings.

name: Cyclops
description: A one-eyed giant who lived in a cave at the foot of Mount Etna. With the help of several sheep, was slain by the Greek hero Odysseus.

name: Cyprian Youdle
description: Only Quidditch referee ever to die during a match. The originator of the curse was never caught but believed to have been a member of the crowd.

name: Daisy Dodderidge
title: Tavern Keeper
description: Daisy Dodderidge built the Leaky Cauldron inn to serve as a gateway between the non-wizarding world and Diagon Alley. Wizards and witches of her day loved her generosity and the welcoming atmosphere of her pub.

name: Derwent Shimpling
title: Comedian
description: Ate an entire Venomous Tentacula for a bet and survived, though still purple. Wizards and witches everywhere love his silly sense of humor and his boldness.

name: Devlin Whitehorn
title: Inventor
description: Founder of the Nimbus Racing Broom Company in 1967. He helped design Nimbus brooms, which revolutionized the game of Quidditch. An expert flyer, he is an avid Quidditch fan who enjoys watching or playing games whenever he can.

name: Donaghan Tremlett
title: Entertainer
description: Bass player with the popular wizarding band The Weird Sisters. Muggle-born, Donaghan is a big fan of the Quidditch team called the Kenmare Kestrels.

name: Dorcas Wellbeloved
description: Founder of the Society for Distressed Witches.

name: Dunbar Oglethorpe
description: Chief of Q.U.A.B.B.L.E. (Quidditch Union for the Administration and Betterment of the British League and its Endeavours).

name: Dymphna Furmage
description: Famously abducted by pixies while on vacation in Cornwall, she lived in mortal dread of them thereafter.

name: Eargit the Ugly
description: Goblin representative at 14th century summit of the Wizards' Council.

name: Edgar Cloggs
description: Ghost who has been hanging around the (Hogwarts) Quidditch Pitch as long as anyone can remember. Edgar was obviously a pretty good player in his day.

name: Edgar Stroulger
description: Inventor of the Sneakoscope.

name: Elfrida Clagg
description: Chieftainess of Warlock's Council.

name: Elladora Ketteridge
description: Witch who discovered the use of Gillyweed when she nearly suffocated after eating it and recovered only when she stuck her head into a bucket of water.

name: Ethelred the Ever-Ready
description: Famous for taking offense at nothing and cursing innocent bystanders. Died in jail.

name: Falco Aesalon
description: The first recorded example of an Animagus, he could transform himself into a falcon.

name: Famous Witches and Wizards Trading Cards
Felix Summerbee
description: Inventor of Cheering Charms.

name: Flavius Belby
description: Only wizard ever to survive a Lethifold attack.

name: Fulbert the Fearful
description: Famous for being so cowardly he never ventured out of his house. Died when a Defensive Charm backfired and the roof fell in.

name: Gaspard Shingleton
description: Celebrated inventor of the Self-Stirring Cauldron.

name: Gideon Crumb
description: Plays bagpipes with the popular wizarding band The Weird Sisters.

name: Gifford Ollerton
title: Giant-Slayer
description: Famous giant-slayer. Killed the giant Hengist of Upper Barnton, and became the town's local hero.

name: Glanmore Peakes
description: Famous slayer of the Sea Serpent of Cromer.

name: Glenda Chittock
description: Popular presenter of the W.W.N. (Wizarding Wireless Network) program Witching Hour.

name: Glover Hipworth
description: Inventor of the Pepperup Potion, cure for the common cold.

name: Godric Gryffindor
title: Co-Founder of Hogwarts
description: Co-founder of Hogwarts. Gave his name to one of the four Hogwarts houses.

name: Goliath
description: Mercenary giant used by the Philistines in their war with the Israelites. Was slain by a young boy with a slingshot.

name: Gondoline Oliphant
description: Famous for studies of life and habits of trolls. Clubbed to death in the Cotswolds while sketching.

name: Gregory the Smarmy
description: Famous originator of Gregory's Unctuous Unction - a potion to persuade the drinker that the giver is their very best friend.

name: Greta Catchlove
description: Author of Charm Your Own Cheese.

name: Gringott
description: Founder of Gringotts Wizarding Bank.

name: Grogan Stump
description: Popular Minister for Magic, appointed in 1811.

name: Grunnion, Alberic
description: Inventor of the Dungbomb.

name: Gulliver Pokeby
description: Expert on magical birds. First to identify meaning of Augurey song.

name: Gunhilda of Gorsemoor
title: Healer
description: One-eyed, hump-backed witch famous for developing a cure for Dragon Pox. When she died, everyone who knew her felt great sorrow, for she was a talented and hardworking healer.

name: Gwenog Jones
title: Quidditch Captain
description: Captain and Beater of only all-female national Quidditch team, the Holyhead Harpies. After a game she enjoys relaxing with friends, drinking Butterbeer, and listening to The Weird Sisters.

name: Harry Potter
description: The boy who lived.

name: Havelock Sweeting
description: Unicorn expert.

name: Heathcote Barbary
description: Plays rhythm guitar with the popular wizarding band The Weird Sisters.

name: Helga Hufflepuff
title: Co-Founder of Hogwarts
description: Co-founder of Hogwarts. Gave her name to one of the four Hogwarts houses. She brought people from different walks of life together to help build Hogwarts and was loved for her charming ways.

name: Hengist of Upper Barnton
description: Giant killed by the famous giant-slayer Gifford Ollerton.

name: Hengist of Woodcroft
title: Founder of Hogsmeade
description: Driven away from his home by Muggle persecutors, Hengist is supposed to have settled in Scotland where he founded the village of Hogsmeade. Some say the Three Broomsticks Inn used to be his home.

name: Herman Wintringham
description: Plays lute with the popular wizarding band The Weird Sisters.

name: Herpo the Foul
description: First known creator of the Basilisk.

name: Hesper Starkey
description: Witch who studied the use of phases of the moon in potion making.

name: Honoria Nutcombe
description: Founded the Society for the Reformation of Hags.

name: Ignatia Wildsmith
description: The witch who invented Floo powder.

name: Jocunda Sykes
description: Famous for flying across the Atlantic on a broomstick - the first person to do so.

name: Joscelind Wadcock
description: Chaser for Puddlemere United Quidditch team.

name: Justus Pilliwickle
description: Celebrated head of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement.

name: Kirley Duke
description: Plays lead guitar with the popular wizarding band The Weird Sisters.

name: Lady Carmilla Sanguina
description: Bathed in the blood of her victims to retain her youthful beauty.

name: Laverne de Montmorency
description: Inventor of many love potions.

name: Leopoldina Smethwyck
description: First British witch to referee a Quidditch match.

name: Leticia Somnolens
description: This spiteful hag was jealous of the king's daughter and caused her to prick her finger on a spindle tainted with a Draught of the Living Death. A young wizard who had smeared his lips with Wiggenweld potion kissed the princess and brought her out of her trance.

name: Lord Stoddard Withers
title: Magical Creatures Specialist
description: Breeder of flying horses. He tried to create interest in a cross between Quidditch and polo played on flying horses, but the sport never became popular.

name: Malodora Grymm
description: Using a beautification potion to conceal her true form, she married a king and used a charmed mirror to reinforce her self-image. Became jealous of the most beautiful girl in the land and fed her a poisoned apple.

name: Merlin
title: Charms Specialist
description: Most famous wizard of all time. Sometimes known as the Prince of Enchanters. Part of the Court of King Arthur. (King Arthur once ruled the land that is now part of England.) Merlin wanted wizards to help Muggles, so he created the Order of Merlin. The Order made rules against using magic on Muggles.

name: Merton Graves
description: Plays cello with the popular wizarding band The Weird Sisters.

name: Merwyn the Malicious
description: Credited with the invention of many unpleasant jinxes and hexes.

name: Mirabella Plunkett
description: Famous for falling in love with a merman in Loch Lomond while on vacation. When her family forbade her to marry him, she transfigured herself into a haddock and was never seen again.

name: Miranda Goshawk
description: Famous spell-book writer.

name: Montague Knightley
description: Wizard Chess Champion.

name: Mopsus
description: Ancient Greek soothsayer who vanquished the Seer Calchas in a contest of their powers.

name: Morgan le Fay
title: Bird Animagus
description: Also known as Morgana, she was King Arthur's half sister. She was a dark sorceress, Merlin's enemy and she affected many events during her time. She was the queen of the island of Avalon, and she had great skill as a healer.

name: Morholt
description: Gigantic brother of the King of Ireland. Wounded Tristan, the Celtic hero, with a poisoned sword when the latter tried to kill him.

name: Mungo Bonham
description: Famous wizard healer. Founded Saint Mungo's Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries.

name: Musidora Barkwith
description: Composer of the unfinished "Wizarding Suite," which features an exploding tuba. Has been banned since its last performance in 1902, when it blew the roof out of Ackerley Town Hall.

name: Myron Wagtail
description: Lead singer of popular wizarding band The Weird Sisters.

name: Newt Scamander
title: Author
description: Celebrated author of Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them. He is currently studying fire slugs in the Brazilian rainforest.

name: Norvel Twonk
description: Died saving a Muggle child from a runaway manticore.

name: Old Mother Hubbard
description: Lured stray animals into her home and starved them to death.

name: Orsino Thruston
description: Plays drums with the popular wizarding band The Weird Sisters.

name: Oswald Beamish
description: Pioneer of goblin rights.

name: Paracelsus
title: Alchemist
description: Very little is known about this secretive wizard.

name: Perpetua Fancourt
description: Witch who invented the Lunascope.

name: Professor Armando Dippet
description: Former Headmaster of Hogwarts, c. 1940.

name: Queen Maeve
description: Witch who trained young sorcerers in Ireland prior to the establishment of Hogwarts.

name: Quong Po
title: Magical Creatures Specialist
description: Born in China, Quong Po studied Chinese Fireball dragons, or Liondragons, and discovered the uses of their powdered eggs.

name: Roderick Plumpton
description: Seeker for England's Quidditch team. Holds British record for fastest capture of the Golden Snitch during game: three and a half seconds.

name: Roland Kegg
description: President of English Gobstones team.

name: Rowena Ravenclaw
title: Co-Founder of Hogwarts
description: Co-founder of Hogwarts. Gave her name to one of the four Hogwarts houses. It's thought that she came up with the ever-changing floor plan. She's best remembered for her intelligence and creativity.

name: Sacharissa Tugwood
title: Inventor
description: Pioneer of Beautifying Potions. Discovered pimple-curing properties of Bubotuber pus. The words on her gravestone read, 'Thanks to Sacharissa Tugwood, the world is a more beautiful place.'

name: Salazar Slytherin
title: Co-Founder of Hogwarts
description: Co-founder of Hogwarts. Gave his name to one of the four Hogwarts houses.

name: Sir Herbert Varney
description: Short-lived (by undead standards) Victorian vampire who preyed upon women in London during the 1880s. Was subsequently captured and killed by a special squad from the Department for the Regulation and Control of Magical Creatures.

name: Thaddeus Thurkell
description: Famous for producing seven Squib sons and turning them all into hedgehogs in disgust.

name: Tilly Toke
description: Gained Order of Merlin, First Class, for saving Muggle lives during the Ilfracombe Incident of 1932, when a dragon swooped down on a beach full of sunbathers.

name: Ug the Unreliable
description: Notorious goblin confidence trickster. Organized the infamous Demiguise Derby and absconded with the takings.

name: Urg the Unclean
description: Rebel leader in the 18th century goblin rebellions.

name: Uric the Oddball
title: Eccentric
description: Highly eccentric wizard who is famed for, among other things, wearing a jellyfish for a hat. No one knows if he meant to be the weirdest wizard of the ages or if it just came naturally.

name: Wendelin the Weird
description: Alleged to have enjoyed being burnt at the stake so much that she allowed herself to be captured over 47 times in various disguises (PA2). [Note: the Wizard Card gives the number of times she was captured as 14].

name: Wilfred Elphick
description: First wizard to be gored by an African Erumpent.

name: Xavier Rastrick
description: Flamboyant wizard entertainer who vanished unexpectedly while tap dancing to a crowd of 300 in Painswick and was never seen again.

name: Yardley Platt
description: Serial goblin-killer.
